los.title: 01: Activities
los.summary: Trace the influences on the Kotlin Programming language. Create and explore a starter Kotlin Android application in detail.

los.title: Evolution
los.summary: Programming language heritage, characteristics & type systems

los.title: Convergence
los.summary: A simple algorithm expressed in Java, Groovy, Swift and Kotlin

los.title: Android: Foundation
los.summary: A first look at the structure of an Android application a Kotlin activity.

los.title: Lab-01 Activities
los.summary: Layout the PlacemarkActivity - supporting create/edit of placemarks

los.title: 02: Adapters
los.summary: Look at Kotlin in more depth. Deep dive into some of its features. Extend the app to manage lists of placemarks using the adapter pattern.

los.title: Kotlin Structure
los.summary: The fundamental characteristics of the language

los.title: Basic Syntax
los.summary: Rapid tour of the basic syntax of Kotlin

los.title: Kotlin Deep Dive
los.summary: A deep dive into some key Kotlin features: Data Classes & Lambdas

los.title: Android Application Object
los.summary: This class enables a global application object to be defined, accessible from all activities

los.title: Recycler View + Adapters
los.summary: Managing lists is facilitated by the RecyclerView + Adapters - 2 key patterns in Android development

los.title: Lab-02 Adapters
los.summary: Introduce new activity to display a list of placemarks. Support adding to this list.

los.title: 03: Models
los.summary: Examine key Kotlin Idioms. Start comparing simple Java & Kotlin statements. Introduce a more complete model into Placemark.

los.title: Kotlin Idioms
los.summary: Kotlin Idioms

los.title: Idioms
los.summary: A tour of the common idioms in Kotlin

los.title: J2K Variables & Expressions
los.summary: Snippets of the same code in Java & Kotlin

los.title: Toolbar
los.summary: The Android Support Library implements AppCompatActivity + a range of general purpose components, including a ToolBar

los.title: Memory Store
los.summary: Abstract the Placemarks data structure into PlacemarkStore interface + in-memory implementation.

los.title: Adapter + Listener
los.summary: Equip the Adapter with a Listener interface. Use this interface to communicate from the adapter to the host Activity

los.title: Parcelable
los.summary: Encapsulate model data for transmission between Activities

los.title: Lab-03 Models
los.summary: Application object + Model classes to manage placemarks.

los.title: 04: Images
los.summary: A more detailed look at the fundamental types in Kotlin. How to manage images in android, including selecting and displaying images from the phone gallery.

los.title: Types
los.summary: Summary of the basic types in the Kotlin programming language

los.title: J2K Collections
los.summary: Collection examples: Java & Kotlin equivalents

los.title: Android Platform, Components & Activities
los.summary: Key features of the platform, the principle components + the activity model

los.title: Resources
los.summary: A general term for all layout, strings, bitmaps and other XML artefacts in an Android Project

los.title: Model Updates
los.summary: Creating and updating a Placemark. Updating the placemark list.

los.title: Images
los.summary: Support selecting image from phone gallery, and then displaying them in an activity.

los.title: Lab-04 Images
los.summary: Allow an image to be selected from the phones photos, and stored with the placemark

los.title: 05: Maps
los.summary: Review Kotlin Packages + Control flow. Introducing Google Maps into and android app.

los.title: Kotlin Packages
los.summary: Source files start with a package declaration. This can be used to access (import) features from the source file.

los.title: Kotlin Control Flow
los.summary: if, when, for and while statements

los.title: J2K Control Flow
los.summary: Control flow examples in Java and Kotlin

los.title: App Structure
los.summary: Key classes and relationships in the application.

los.title: Map Activity
los.summary: Google Map Activity can be inserted into an app via a Wizard from Studio. API Keys must be acquired from google directly.

los.title: Cameras & Markers
los.summary: These abstractions enable the map view to be manipulated programatically, and facilitate direct manipulation by the user.

los.title: Lab-05 MapActivity
los.summary: Include a MapActivity, enabling the user to select the location of the placemark

los.title: 06: Persistence
los.summary: Kotlin Classes in detail. New Placemark Store class to save placemarks to the file system.

los.title: Kotlin Classes I
los.summary: Kotlin Classes I

los.title: Classes & Inheritance
los.summary: In kotlin, classes are more concise, explicit and fine-grained then Java

los.title: J2K: Functions
los.summary: Functions in Java & Kotlin

los.title: Persistence
los.summary: Korlin classes & Inheritance. Storing and retrieving placemarks. JSON file serialization

los.title: File Formats
los.summary: When a simple file persistence strategy, CSV, Name/Value, YAML, XML & JSON are all potential candidate formats for file-based storage.

los.title: JSON
los.summary: A detailed look at the syntax of JSON

los.title: JSON Store
los.summary: A new PlacemarkStore implementation - PlacemarkJSONStore - to persist placemarks to a JSON file.

los.summary: Save and restore placemarks from a JSON formatted file

los.title: 07: Layouts
los.summary: Kotlin properties, fields, & interfaces. Constraint Layout. Introduce activity to display all placemark locations + details.

los.summary: Kotlin properties and fields offer a richer set of features and variants over Java

los.title: J2K : Classes
los.summary: Classes in Java & Kotlin

los.title: Layouts
los.summary: Constraint layout. Managing embedded maps. Initialisation and manipulation.

los.summary: ConstraintLayout allows you to create large and complex layouts with a flat view

los.summary: Introduce an activity to display all placemarks on a single map.

los.summary: Display all placemarks on a map in a new activity

los.summary: Introducing Model View Presenter - a pattern to enhance separation of concerns in the Activity classes

los.title: Interfaces
los.summary: Kotlin interfaces largely follow Java 8 conventions

los.summary: Classes, objects, interfaces, constructors, functions, properties and their setters can have visibility modifiers.

los.summary: Factor out common MVP features into BaseView/Presenter classes

los.title: 09: Location
los.summary: Kotlin visibility & extensions. Determine the devices current location & resolve in a map.

los.summary: The ability to extend a class with new functionality without having to inherit from the class

los.summary: Configure Markers and listen for marker events

los.summary: When creating a new placemark, use the current location as the starting point.

los.summary: Configure Markers and listen for marker events

los.summary: Extend the location facility to track location in real time.

los.summary: Classes can be nested in other classes. Enums provide an elegant notation for a limited set of constant values
